speaker: Breitbart
vclaim: Loretta Lynch, the new candidate for Attorney General, "was a member of the Bill Clinton Defence Team during the Whitewater 1992 corruption investigation."
date: stated on November 8, 2014 in a story:
title: Brittbart got Loretta Lynch's wrong Whitewater claim.
text: :: President Barack Obama presented some political news during the weekend, nominating the Federal Attorney General of Loretta Lynch to replace the outgoing Prosecutor General, Eric Holder. The announcement sent news staff jogging for a better understanding of Lynch's political perspectives and a better understanding of the possibility that they might be confirmed by the United States Senate. The Brightbart news site revealed a controversial line in Lynch's autobiography. "The new Obama candidate for Attorney General Loretta Lynch represented Clintons in Whitewater," I read an address from Warner Todd Houston Warner Bart. Houston wrote: There's only one problem. Brittbart got the wrong Loretta Lynch. This error was first noted by liberal journalists working in the media. Britt eventually admitted to correcting that they got Lynch wrong, but left the story anyway. Later, Brightbart deleted the story, although it had already spread to another conspiracy, opinion and conservative news sites such as WND, Sudaheed.com and the American thinker. In this case, the "truth or meter" must not strive to arrive at an assessment, but we believe it is important to address it anyway because of the rapid spread of false information about the Internet. He mentioned Greg Kelly on January 11, 2021 in a television section that says Joe Biden is on a video that announces fraud in the election at the Confession. • On January 12, 2021, Loretta Lynch, a candidate to replace Holder, began to serve as a federal prosecutor in the Eastern District of New York in 1990, and was not even part of Clinton's defense after a few years. According to her official curriculum vitae, Obama Lynch was appointed on 3 May 2010 as the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York, an office previously led by him from 1999 to 2001. The other Loretta Lynch obtained a degree in law from Yale University and worked on several political campaigns, including Clinton, according to her curriculum vitae. Loretta Lynch served as Chairman of the California Public Utilities Committee in 2000-2002 and as Commissioner until 2005. We took this picture of her from her last appearance on C-SPAN, when she was talking to senators in 2002 about an alleged scheme by Enron to manipulate California's energy prices. In an article on Brettbart that has since been deleted, Loretta Lynch, Obama's new candidate for Attorney General, said, "She was a member of Bill Clinton's defense team during the Whitewater corruption investigation in 1992. The conservative news site got the wrong Loretta Lynch. We hope that the correction will spread as quickly as the original story spreads. This claim values the pants of fire.
